race_form.race_comment: BELAIR BRAE (4) had a tough draw to overcome and was game in defeat when only 2 lengths from Bourne Sarah in third (23.26) at Mt Gambier. Top prospect. MAYBE SPAGHETTI (8) broke from a low draw and filled a minor placing last start, beaten only a nose (23.34) behind Ohana Paw Patrol at Mt Gambier. Will give a great sight again. GRAY ELLIOT (1) shapes well after a swift run last time, finishing second in a Grade 6 at Horsham in 23.27. In form and looks a leading player again. BELAIR RIC (7) cannot be underestimated.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: BELAIR BRAE (4) had a tough draw to overcome and was game in defeat when only 2 lengths from Bourne Sarah in third (23.26) at Mt Gambier. Top prospect. MAYBE SPAGHETTI (8) broke from a low draw and filled a minor placing last start, beaten only a nose (23.34) behind Ohana Paw Patrol at Mt Gambier. Will give a great sight again. GRAY ELLIOT (1) shapes well after a swift run last time, finishing second in a Grade 6 at Horsham in 23.27. In form and looks a leading player again. BELAIR RIC (7) cannot be underestimated.

race_form.race_comment: DOUGS PLATTER (5) has taken on the top four-year-olds in both starts since a spell and has been far from disgraced when midfield both times from wide barriers. He is well placed in this line-up and should be approaching peak fitness. MY ULTIMATE SNOWY (7) looks close to another win following back-to-back placings at this circuit, last week leading and sticking on for a 2.2m third. Draws wider but is going well. GLENLEDI ELVIS (6) is flying at present, making it back-to-back wins with his last-start victory in the Albury Cup. Building an impressive strike rate so can measure up in his first attempt in the city. FASHION ICON (1) was a solid fourth after racing parked when resuming and is open to improvement aided by the ace draw.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: DOUGS PLATTER (5) has taken on the top four-year-olds in both starts since a spell and has been far from disgraced when midfield both times from wide barriers. He is well placed in this line-up and should be approaching peak fitness. MY ULTIMATE SNOWY (7) looks close to another win following back-to-back placings at this circuit, last week leading and sticking on for a 2.2m third. Draws wider but is going well. GLENLEDI ELVIS (6) is flying at present, making it back-to-back wins with his last-start victory in the Albury Cup. Building an impressive strike rate so can measure up in his first attempt in the city. FASHION ICON (1) was a solid fourth after racing parked when resuming and is open to improvement aided by the ace draw.

race_form.race_comment: ABLETT FLYER (7) shows ability but remains a maiden after six starts. Is better than last start when out of the placings, finishing eighth (25.77) at Shepparton. Should be very hard to beat this time. ASTON MEEK (5) turned in a modest effort most recently when eighth at Mt Gambier over 512m behind Special Herbs (31.60) in a Grade 6. Can do much better this time. BOGGY DOZER (8) copped a check in the run and finished a well held 5 lengths third (23.86) last time in a Grade 6 at Mt Gambier over 400m. Harder here but will be in this for a long way. JUNIOR RUSLIE (4) looks a chance coming off a five weeks layoff.

0401a3dd-d35f-499d-ad55-47b3b73cee24.race_name: Ladbroke It! 1-4 Win Heat 2 1-4 Wins H

race_form.race_comment: WHO KNOWS GUS (7) is a talented type and proved too classy last time to win by 7 lengths at Gunnedah in a handy 30.12 beating Billy Bush. Has run slick time here, with a 29.91 PB at this distance. Ideally placed to take this out. BOSTON BANNER (4) finished fourth last time at Richmond but could not have been more impressive before that in his excellent 34.31 win at The Gardens over 600m. Expected to feature on best figures. QUICK TO JUDGE (3) with some luck can improve on an unplaced run last time here.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: WHO KNOWS GUS (7) is a talented type and proved too classy last time to win by 7 lengths at Gunnedah in a handy 30.12 beating Billy Bush. Has run slick time here, with a 29.91 PB at this distance. Ideally placed to take this out. BOSTON BANNER (4) finished fourth last time at Richmond but could not have been more impressive before that in his excellent 34.31 win at The Gardens over 600m. Expected to feature on best figures. QUICK TO JUDGE (3) with some luck can improve on an unplaced run last time here.

race_form.race_comment: KASHINO BILLBOARD (11) a sequence of wins was broken last time out when he finished second over 1400m at this track although only one length from the winner. Well-placed and a top chance again. COSMO AVANZA (5) lines up for the hat-trick after registering a strong win last time over 1400m at this track, scoring by a head. Has two wins from four starts at this circuit. Likely to feature again. SHIGERU SCORPION (1) is in top form, most recently recording a win by a neck over 1400m at this track to make it two in succession. Should settle handy in the run. Winning claims on best figures. BAKERU (7) turned in a fine effort to win by one length at this course and distance last start to maintain his good form of late. Looks well placed so expect another big run.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: KASHINO BILLBOARD (11) a sequence of wins was broken last time out when he finished second over 1400m at this track although only one length from the winner. Well-placed and a top chance again. COSMO AVANZA (5) lines up for the hat-trick after registering a strong win last time over 1400m at this track, scoring by a head. Has two wins from four starts at this circuit. Likely to feature again. SHIGERU SCORPION (1) is in top form, most recently recording a win by a neck over 1400m at this track to make it two in succession. Should settle handy in the run. Winning claims on best figures. BAKERU (7) turned in a fine effort to win by one length at this course and distance last start to maintain his good form of late. Looks well placed so expect another big run.

race_form.race_comment: JULY (8) is on a seven-day back-up after finishing in the money over 1200m at this track. Gets in with 2kgs less under today's scale. Drawn out but is expected to go well again. OTAHUHU (2) is a four-start maiden who could only manage to finish sixth after being in the firing line on the turn at his latest appearance over 1200m on turf. This looks a nice race so expect him to be right in the finish. DRAGON BOSS (1) resumes. Form last prep was way below what he is capable of. Has the ability to test these if back in good order. LIM'S EVEREST (10) finished 10 lengths from the winner in eighth at his most recent outing over 1200m on turf after he was well back on straightening. Likely to be thereabouts in this plain affair.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: JULY (8) is on a seven-day back-up after finishing in the money over 1200m at this track. Gets in with 2kgs less under today's scale. Drawn out but is expected to go well again. LIM'S EVEREST (10) finished 10 lengths from the winner in eighth at his most recent outing over 1200m on turf after he was well back on straightening. Likely to be thereabouts in this plain affair.

race_form.race_comment: Tricky race to close with many in-form runners locking horns. TAHNEE TREASURE (6) has been ultra-impressive in her last two starts, making very light work of his rivals en route to success. Drawn kinder and there's no reason she can't win again. MARVELOUS NIGHT (4) meets TAHNEE TREASURE 3kgs better this time after falling 2.7L shy last start and shouldn't spend a penny from the draw. Could prove all the difference. RISING LEGEND (2) fell a whisker shy of bringing up the hat-trick here last start. Carries more weight for the drop in grade but is among the leading players. DALE'S ROCKET (3) is another that is ticking along nicely, finishing inside the top two in his last four starts. Boasts a strong record over this journey and is drawn to advantage. Expect him to be in this for a long way. WOLFBURN (1) lacked a fitness edge late when just missing the minors. Better for the run and is worth including. IMPOSSIBLE ACTION  (5) next best.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: Tricky race to close with many in-form runners locking horns. TAHNEE TREASURE (6) has been ultra-impressive in her last two starts, making very light work of his rivals en route to success. Drawn kinder and there's no reason she can't win again. MARVELOUS NIGHT (4) meets TAHNEE TREASURE 3kgs better this time after falling 2.7L shy last start and shouldn't spend a penny from the draw. Could prove all the difference. RISING LEGEND (2) fell a whisker shy of bringing up the hat-trick here last start. Carries more weight for the drop in grade but is among the leading players. DALE'S ROCKET (3) is another that is ticking along nicely, finishing inside the top two in his last four starts. Boasts a strong record over this journey and is drawn to advantage. Expect him to be in this for a long way. WOLFBURN (1) lacked a fitness edge late when just missing the minors. Better for the run and is worth including. IMPOSSIBLE ACTION  (5) next best.

race_form.race_comment: ARRAN BAY (4) has a very strong second-up record and did enough first-up when given a quiet ride at this track and trip, working home well for sixth, beaten just two lengths. Fancy he's able to sit closer this time from the better draw and he should be right in the finish. SO RISQUE (2) won that race at healthy odds and has since gone to Rosehill and placed in Bm88 grade. Racing very well and will take beating again. HE'S OUR BONNEVAL (7) comes through the same form and should be at peak fitness now third up. Same story LOUNGE BAR RUBI (5) who ran second and has winning claims again. SANDY PRINCE (9) brings different form off a smart win in Adelaide and he can measure up.

Same story LOUNGE BAR RUBI (5) who ran second and has winning claims again. SANDY PRINCE (9) brings different form off a smart win in Adelaide and he can measure up.

race_form.race_comment: Group 2 placegetter COAL CRUSHER (2) returned in good order when sat on the speed before knocking up late when a long neck second over 1200m in the G2 Expressway Stakes at this track on February 17. This his pet trip and expected to cross from the wide gate and take catching. Group 3 placegetter HARD TO SAY (11) underrated sprinter stretching out to the 1300m for the first time today. Worked home late when second over 1200m in the G3 Southern Cross Stakes at Rosehill on February 3. Gets every chance from the gate. Caulfield Guineas winner GOLDEN MILE (3) showed good early speed before tiring late when last of 7 over 1200m in the G2 Expressway Stakes. Can stalk the speed and improve sharply. WHINCHAT (13) progressive gelding chasing his third-straight victory. Returned slick figures as favourite when a 1.75 len winner over this track and trip on February 17. Has a fitness edge over most of these but takes on much stronger company today.

Has a fitness edge over most of these but takes on much stronger company today.

race_form.race_comment: TAVI TIME (1) skipped through a few grades late last campaign and goes into this first-up after just one trial. Progressive type hard to hold out. NOSEY PARKER (2) does his best racing at this track and was a dominant winner at the latest outing. From the rails draw should get a genuine crack at this. VAIN INVADER (7) was back in winning form last start when he scored at Sapphire Coast - ready to take another step forward third-up from a break. PRIME IMPACT (5) worth keeping safe.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: TAVI TIME (1) skipped through a few grades late last campaign and goes into this first-up after just one trial. Progressive type hard to hold out. NOSEY PARKER (2) does his best racing at this track and was a dominant winner at the latest outing. From the rails draw should get a genuine crack at this. VAIN INVADER (7) was back in winning form last start when he scored at Sapphire Coast - ready to take another step forward third-up from a break. PRIME IMPACT (5) worth keeping safe.

race_form.race_comment: MAX GOLD (3) broke through for his maiden win over 1200m at this track last time, scoring comfortably. Sparingly raced and has more to offer. Has a low draw and he should be in the finish. GEOSEN CHAMP (9) doesn't win out of turn, scoring just once from 12 starts. Did a good job last start to finish third over 1300m at this track, beaten 4.5 lengths. Suitably placed so anticipating a big run. CLOVER PARTY (7) turned in a sound effort last time but found one better at this track over 1400m, beaten 0.8 lengths. Ready to win. MORNING PEARL (10) is a maiden with eight minor placings to her name. Could not improve on that record when resuming last start, winding up in fifth over 1400m at this track. Generally runs well second up. Jo In Kwon has registered two minor placings when on board. Not to be discounted.

Generally runs well second up. Jo In Kwon has registered two minor placings when on board. Not to be discounted.

race_form.race_comment: KAHINA (2) drew a wide gate last start and wasn't disgraced beaten 4.5 metres into seventh at this track over 1800m. No excuses from this more advantageous draw and has the class to take this out. KEILAH (3) has been racing well, filling a top-five position at her last four starts including a second most recently at this venue over 1800m. Likely to get all the favours from this nice draw and cannot be discounted. UBETCHA (11) scored two runs back then his luck changed last time when he broke and finished a long way back in eighth over 1800m here. Finds a nice race and can make up for that last start mishap. CLARENDEN LEGACY (7) is in the mix following a respectable third at his most recent appearance over 1800m at this circuit. May earn some minor money.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: KAHINA (2) drew a wide gate last start and wasn't disgraced beaten 4.5 metres into seventh at this track over 1800m. No excuses from this more advantageous draw and has the class to take this out. CLARENDEN LEGACY (7) is in the mix following a respectable third at his most recent appearance over 1800m at this circuit. May earn some minor money.

race_form.race_comment: BETTERZIPPIT (5) showed signs that he may be returning to his best when he resumed wit a fourth at this venue a fortnight ago. Proven second-up and strikes at 50 per cent at this circuit so could progress enough to win this. PETES SAID SO (4) draws well and will find this easier than his recent attempts when behind Leap To Fame. He can make an impact in this line-up. BROOKLYN BRIDGE (1) improved off a fresh placing to win well last week. Has won two of three third-up attempts and led in last week's victory so can take advantage of the inside draw. MISSED THE TRUTH (10) draws wide but he is hard to knock off a string of wins and placings. BRAEVIEW KELLY (8) is a smart mare who can progress off the fresh placing.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: BETTERZIPPIT (5) showed signs that he may be returning to his best when he resumed wit a fourth at this venue a fortnight ago. Proven second-up and strikes at 50 per cent at this circuit so could progress enough to win this. MISSED THE TRUTH (10) draws wide but he is hard to knock off a string of wins and placings. BRAEVIEW KELLY (8) is a smart mare who can progress off the fresh placing.

race_form.race_comment: YARECKON IM SWEET (1) has switched to Tasmania since she produced a strong effort at her latest appearance when she led from a wider barrier and fought well to score at Wagga in January. She has the speed to take advantage of the ace draw. SHARKATTACK (6) continued a run of top-two finishes when he got home by 1.8m over 2090m at this circuit last start. Hard to knock the recent consistency. KHAKI NUI (8) is racing well with placings in three of the last four starts, last time out finishing third at this venue. Genuine threat. CEDRIC SEYMOUR (7) owns a good record here so deserves respect.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: YARECKON IM SWEET (1) has switched to Tasmania since she produced a strong effort at her latest appearance when she led from a wider barrier and fought well to score at Wagga in January. She has the speed to take advantage of the ace draw. SHARKATTACK (6) continued a run of top-two finishes when he got home by 1.8m over 2090m at this circuit last start. Hard to knock the recent consistency. KHAKI NUI (8) is racing well with placings in three of the last four starts, last time out finishing third at this venue. Genuine threat. CEDRIC SEYMOUR (7) owns a good record here so deserves respect.

race_form.race_comment: Prepared to forgive the latest result of JAMES CAGNEY (2) when he drew the back row. Much better served by this barrier and was good in scoring by 7.6m at this circuit two starts ago. PUNTARNO STRIDE (9) galloped away from the stand start last time but was racing well before that, placing in three of his previous four outings. The return to a mobile start should suit. Primary contender. PARDOE PLUGGA (3) scored two back at Carrick and didn't do a bad job when fourth at Launceston last time out. Drawn to play a role. MESSERATI (7) recorded a string of top-two finishes prior to the last effort and races well at this distance.

MESSERATI (7) recorded a string of top-two finishes prior to the last effort and races well at this distance.

race_form.race_comment: MISS ADVENTURER (2) won by 12 lengths last start at this track 520m in a respectable 30.63. Hard to top on the time from last start. HILL'S LEGEND (8) is struggling to break through but racing consistently, finishing in the minors four starts on end. Last time out flew the lids with a fast early sectional but gathered in and finished second (30.79) at this track over 520m. Safe beginner but wide box to overcome and will need some luck. Leading chance. WHY A BLAZE (3) ran an eyecatching debut February 24 at this track over 520m (31.74) after starting from out wide. Good beginner aided by a nice draw. Can measure up. BILLIE CASH KID (6) was strongly fancied last time but finished third (30.88), beaten 2.25 lengths. Speedy beginner who can find the front despite the tricky draw. Well placed and gets his chance.

race_form.race_comment: SONIC SONNY (1) filled a minor placing last start at this track behind Ruby Wren (23.05) in a Maiden. Stalked the pace but found the line strongly. Can measure up this time. PELICAN FLYER (4) finished midfield on debut when fifth (17.33) at Healesville over 300m. Can feature with the right run. JEFF THE MAN (8) is yet to win in 11 starts but been in the minors. Expected to feature. SAINT FINNIE (6) returns after a break and looks a top-three hope.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: SONIC SONNY (1) filled a minor placing last start at this track behind Ruby Wren (23.05) in a Maiden. Stalked the pace but found the line strongly. Can measure up this time. PELICAN FLYER (4) finished midfield on debut when fifth (17.33) at Healesville over 300m. Can feature with the right run. JEFF THE MAN (8) is yet to win in 11 starts but been in the minors. Expected to feature. SAINT FINNIE (6) returns after a break and looks a top-three hope.

race_form.race_comment: SAPPHIRE STREET (10) looked a spent force second-up but showed good improvement last time out over 1300m. The same tactics will probably be adopted from the wide draw and the rise to 1400m doesn't appear an issue based off her latest start. No Petula here this time and she can get back to winning ways. MEMORY PARADE (12) looks an up-and-coming 3YO who held her own against the boys 10 days ago. This is easier and with plenty of upside still there, she's sure to stick her nose into the finish. SHAKA ZULU (7) may have just felt the pinch second-up and looks primed to bounce back. He is a third-up winner previously and if he can get back to his best, he'll be making his presence felt. MAMA TEMBU (5) has form that ties through SAPPHIRE STREET and is not to be discounted. THEHORSEMAN (4) must be included on his recent form.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: SAPPHIRE STREET (10) looked a spent force second-up but showed good improvement last time out over 1300m. The same tactics will probably be adopted from the wide draw and the rise to 1400m doesn't appear an issue based off her latest start. No Petula here this time and she can get back to winning ways. MAMA TEMBU (5) has form that ties through SAPPHIRE STREET and is not to be discounted. THEHORSEMAN (4) must be included on his recent form.

race_form.race_comment: PASS MARK (2) has been mixing form lately, hitting the frame two back before finishing fifth (30.38) at this track in a Mix 6/7. Better than last run and makes appeal this time. CABAO KYANITE (7) recorded his 2nd career win last time at this track, scoring by 2.5 lengths (30.32). Expected to feature again. DAINTREE GRANITE (1) boxed on well to finish second last time, beaten 1.2 lengths (29.05) behind Bon Rose at Sale. Overdue and gets his chance. CABAO LAPIS (8) among the chances again based on last run here.

DAINTREE GRANITE (1) boxed on well to finish second last time, beaten 1.2 lengths (29.05) behind Bon Rose at Sale. Overdue and gets his chance. CABAO LAPIS (8) among the chances again based on last run here.

race_form.race_comment: Hard to knock the form of BANGKOK DEEJAY (5) who made it four wins in a row at this circuit when he came from the second line and scored at the latest outing four weeks ago, coming in 7 metres ahead of his rivals. Building impressive circuit and distance statistics. Can do it again. RED RIGHT HAND (8) is close to a win following back-to-back placings, the latest effort a second at this venue. Can travel in a nice spot from this draw and wait on the sprint lane if necessary. Big chance to go one better. OK BOOMER (7) draws wide but is worth plenty of thought off a last-start win by close to 4 metres at this circuit. SCOTCH EN ICE (6) must be respected off a dominant last-start win.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: Hard to knock the form of BANGKOK DEEJAY (5) who made it four wins in a row at this circuit when he came from the second line and scored at the latest outing four weeks ago, coming in 7 metres ahead of his rivals. OK BOOMER (7) draws wide but is worth plenty of thought off a last-start win by close to 4 metres at this circuit. SCOTCH EN ICE (6) must be respected off a dominant last-start win.

race_form.race_comment: TOP GUN MAVERICK (3) finished third just seven days ago over 1200m at this track. On the quick back-up over more ground. Good effort last start and shapes as a major threat. SUBTLE MIND (2) finished out of the money two starts back then he settled well back and was beaten 3 lengths when sixth over 1500m at this track two weeks ago. The engagement of C Perkins is noteworthy. Has the talent to take this out. YIU CHEUNG VICTORY (7) ran well below his best last time over 1800m at this track, beaten 4 lengths into fifth at $4. Can bounce back. CHEERS BROTHERS (6) won at this track two starts ago but was below his best at a more recent appearance, finishing sixth over 1800m at this track. Nicely placed to make amends.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: TOP GUN MAVERICK (3) finished third just seven days ago over 1200m at this track. On the quick back-up over more ground. Good effort last start and shapes as a major threat. SUBTLE MIND (2) finished out of the money two starts back then he settled well back and was beaten 3 lengths when sixth over 1500m at this track two weeks ago. The engagement of C Perkins is noteworthy. Has the talent to take this out. YIU CHEUNG VICTORY (7) ran well below his best last time over 1800m at this track, beaten 4 lengths into fifth at $4. Can bounce back. CHEERS BROTHERS (6) won at this track two starts ago but was below his best at a more recent appearance, finishing sixth over 1800m at this track. Nicely placed to make amends.

race_form.race_comment: NO SHARES (2) turned in a better run last time to find a minor placing (30.11) at this track behind Kemp Street in a Maiden. Has the early speed to land on the pace and can stick on. One of the leading chances. PROJECT ALICE (5) ran a nice race on debut when hitting the frame, finishing third (23.62) at this track over 400m. Expected to do much better this time. IKE THE BRUTE (3) has his first outing without a trial but profiles nicely for this. Can sneak into the finish on debut.

IKE THE BRUTE (3) has his first outing without a trial but profiles nicely for this. Can sneak into the finish on debut.

race_form.race_comment: ACTION ROYALE (7) jumps from box 7 for the first time after placing latest at this track (22.73) in a Maiden. Sure to be about the mark. SAM'S GIRL (1) has been out of the placings at her last couple but on the winners' heels when placing three back (23.86) in a Maiden at Mt Gambier. This looks easier and expected to improve sharply. MAKE US DREAM (2) finished well back on debut when eighth (17.42) at Healesville over 300m. Can hit the frame this time. CAUSING RUBBLE (8) is another with top-three prospects.

race_form.race_comment: STAR VICTORY (5) turned things around last start and landed the prize by 4.5 lengths after being in contention on the turn over 1400m at this track. Suitably placed so anticipating another big run. GAMELY (1) missed the frame for the first time in a while when fourth over 1200m at this track three weeks ago, beaten 6 lengths. Worth noting Bruno Viana Queiroz goes back aboard. In the right race and there is no reason he cannot get the major prize. BIG DAY (10) was safely held last start when 10 lengths from the winner in tenth at this track and distance after jumping from a wide gate. Backmarker who will prove tough to stop if he brings his best form. LEGACY REIGN (13) gave away a big start at the top of the straight last start and finished 7 lengths from the winner in 13th over 1400m at this track. Cannot be ruled out from a far better gate this time.

LEGACY REIGN (13) gave away a big start at the top of the straight last start and finished 7 lengths from the winner in 13th over 1400m at this track. Cannot be ruled out from a far better gate this time.

race_form.race_comment: URANA JASMINE (2) recorded her best time this course and distance latest, finishing a 2.5 lengths second behind Oregon Favors in 30.19. Top run latest and looms as the one to beat. ALL ABOUT IVY (1) was prominent throughout when winning two back but could manage only midfield last time when 6th and beaten 13 lengths at Sandown (30.60). The form from her last run stacks up well. Has ability and is one of the better chances. NASHVILLE BALE (7) was favourite last start and led all the way, scoring by 4.5 lengths (30.22) at this track in a Grade 7 over 525m. Expecting another bold showing. GO FOR GOLD (3) cannot be ruled out.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: URANA JASMINE (2) recorded her best time this course and distance latest, finishing a 2.5 lengths second behind Oregon Favors in 30.19. Has ability and is one of the better chances. NASHVILLE BALE (7) was favourite last start and led all the way, scoring by 4.5 lengths (30.22) at this track in a Grade 7 over 525m. Expecting another bold showing. GO FOR GOLD (3) cannot be ruled out.

race_form.race_comment: DELAGO LAD (5) trailed off at the back end of his last prep and was sent for a well-deserved spell. He has won twice fresh up from 5 starts and has the blinkers back on for his return. He is nicely placed after a 3-kilo claim and has to be respected as a winner of 5 races on this circuit. DESIGN ARTIST (1) did not really fire at Darwin last year and has had a decent spell since then. He has not missed a cheque in 3 starts on this track and with the blinkers on for the first time, he should be given some chance in a small field. BULLINACHINASHOP (4) will be peaking third-up after a couple of runs at Darwin to open this prep. She is over 5 weeks between runs and can figure in the finish here. MADAM MISCHIEF (2) needed her fresh-up run here 3 weeks ago in a tougher field. She might need another run yet but with only 4 other rivals she can't be risked. TANGO STEPZ (3) stuck to her task gamely fresh up when finishing third last start. She has the perfect inside gate and can place again.

TANGO STEPZ (3) stuck to her task gamely fresh up when finishing third last start. She has the perfect inside gate and can place again.

947b9a72-3b38-4239-9365-46f237fa4c87.race_name: Nsw Gbota Welcome 1-4 Win Heat 1 1-4 Wins H

race_form.race_comment: FORNERS STORM (7) won again in an impressive display after leading them home to make it two on end, scoring by 3.5 lengths (29.73) at Dapto over 520m. Comes through a solid form race last start. The hardest to beat again. BLAZING BARRY (1) took the sit on the lead but levelled up to score (25.18) at Maitland in a Grade 5 over 450m. Yet to miss the placings in four runs from this box, including two wins. Makes plenty of appeal if runs up to latest. ASHBY LISA (2) has shown good improvement at her last two starts, finishing in the money last time when 2nd at this track over 520m. Good beginner aided by a nice draw. Expected to feature again. FLYING FOR AARON (8) is new to this circuit but warrants respect.

race_form.race_comment_alternative: FORNERS STORM (7) won again in an impressive display after leading them home to make it two on end, scoring by 3.5 lengths (29.73) at Dapto over 520m. Comes through a solid form race last start. The hardest to beat again. BLAZING BARRY (1) took the sit on the lead but levelled up to score (25.18) at Maitland in a Grade 5 over 450m. Yet to miss the placings in four runs from this box, including two wins. Makes plenty of appeal if runs up to latest. ASHBY LISA (2) has shown good improvement at her last two starts, finishing in the money last time when 2nd at this track over 520m. Good beginner aided by a nice draw. Expected to feature again. FLYING FOR AARON (8) is new to this circuit but warrants respect.

race_form.race_comment: CENTURY FOX (3) only battled into fifth place fresh up here a fortnight ago after being well-found in the markets. He made some nice progress during his last campaign and will be a lot fitter for his last start hit out. He slides back slightly in class and should be among the hardest to beat. FANTASY EAGLE (5) does improve with racing and was fair in the run to the line when finishing fourth fresh up. He lands the pole position again and can figure in the top three this time. THAT'S JUSTIFIED (1) is a quality veteran gelding who was third when resuming in a tougher field here 2 weeks ago. He has won 20 times on this track and can add to that tally here, especially with the aid of a 3-kilo claim. ZELRING (4) is another tough campaigner who almost races exclusively on this track. He might need the run but is very nicely placed at the weights and he can never be ruled out in any field here.

race_form.race_comment: DAWSON'S BEAR (1) turned in a plain effort last time when sixth at this track over 431m behind Kinematic (26.96) in a Maiden. Form from his last run is proving strong. Ready to return to form. I'M REFINED (2) turned in a moderate run last time when fifth at this track over 630m behind No Ordinary Gal (38.06) in a Restricted WIN. Must be included in calculations. NEED A MOMENT (3) is a 30 start maiden who has placed 12 times, the latest finishing sixth at this track. The form out of last race has been strong. Key runner on best form. SWOOPER'S BIAS (7) has to be respected despite coming off a five-and-a-half months break.

SWOOPER'S BIAS (7) has to be respected despite coming off a five-and-a-half months break.

race_form.race_comment: OUR MAJOR JACK (3) has been racing well of late. Finished fifth at his latest appearance over 1800m at this track, beaten 6 metres. Likely to get all the favours from this nice draw and rates a primary contender based on those recent efforts. JOONIOR BROWN (1) wasn't disgraced last time when he finished sixth over 1800m here. Likely to get all the favours from this nice draw and is a leading hope based on his best figures. BUTTER CUP (8) is looming as a real threat after a better effort last start, finishing second at this circuit over 1800m. Top-three credentials. ALWAYS BE CHLOE (7) must be included on the back of some solid recent form, most recently when third at this venue over 1800m. One for the multiples.

ALWAYS BE CHLOE (7) must be included on the back of some solid recent form, most recently when third at this venue over 1800m. One for the multiples.

race_form.race_comment: DENNY (2) is a newcomer to the Gath yard from NZ. Last seen when fifth at Cambridge six weeks ago and was racing consistently before that with a string of top-four finishes. Can make an immediate impact from the ace draw. ANOTHER NIEN (8) wasn't disgraced when midfield from wider on the back row last start. Drawn for a nice trail this time and had won two of his previous three starts so rates highly. CLYMENUS (6) is worth plenty of thought after his last-start win by 1.8 metres at Bendigo gave him four victories from his last five outings. CURYO GENTLEMAN (10) cops a second row draw but is in contention off back-to-back wins.

ANOTHER NIEN (8) wasn't disgraced when midfield from wider on the back row last start. Drawn for a nice trail this time and had won two of his previous three starts so rates highly. CLYMENUS (6) is worth plenty of thought after his last-start win by 1.8 metres at Bendigo gave him four victories from his last five outings. CURYO GENTLEMAN (10) cops a second row draw but is in contention off back-to-back wins.

race_form.race_comment: Tough. CHOWDAH (3) placed twice at Tamworth over this distance and then came back in trip at Quirindi and settled much too far back. Has the rail today and can bounce back on the 8-day return. WILDERNESS STAR (5) spiked her figures winning the 58 at Grafton. Races forward and has a handy 2kg claim in easier. She's worth another chance over a mile. JIMMY MANOLO (1) resumes for a Sydney stable. Will race over further but kicking off at the mile should suit and he has a soft barrier and 3kg claim. His best form would see him in the finish. EVERYREADY BUNNY (10) was well supported at Tamworth over 1400m and wasn't beaten far. He's in the mix again. DODGEBALL (6) would be a chance measuring on the Taree placing two back.

His best form would see him in the finish. EVERYREADY BUNNY (10) was well supported at Tamworth over 1400m and wasn't beaten far. He's in the mix again. DODGEBALL (6) would be a chance measuring on the Taree placing two back.

race_form.race_comment: CHERI CHERI LADY (2) is a handily bred pup making her debut without a trial. Leading chance to break through. JOHN'S FLASH (3) is a Bruce Mcintosh-trained newcomer by Aussie Infrared out of Sheza Blue Girl with no trial form to work with. Betting to provide the best guide to his chances. FOXY FLORENCE (1) is yet to win in six starts but been in the minors. Can measure up. NO MORE RUM (7) was in the money last start at big odds - poses a threat again.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: CHERI CHERI LADY (2) is a handily bred pup making her debut without a trial. Leading chance to break through. JOHN'S FLASH (3) is a Bruce Mcintosh-trained newcomer by Aussie Infrared out of Sheza Blue Girl with no trial form to work with. Betting to provide the best guide to his chances. FOXY FLORENCE (1) is yet to win in six starts but been in the minors. Can measure up. NO MORE RUM (7) was in the money last start at big odds - poses a threat again.

race_form.race_comment: CRACK THE VAULT (8) turned in a much better effort at his second Tasmanian start, finishing third over 1609m at this circuit last time. Had put together a hat trick of wins before leaving the mainland so is capable. Shouldn't spend a penny from this draw. Has winning claims. MY ULTIMATE JACKO (6) is a newcomer to Tasmania having last raced when successful by 2 metres at Wagga five weeks ago. Can measure right up. SCARLET PLACE (10) draws on the back line but is in contention after scoring last start by 3.2 metres at this venue. FIESTA STRIDE (5) is in the mix having placed in both starts since winning here.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: CRACK THE VAULT (8) turned in a much better effort at his second Tasmanian start, finishing third over 1609m at this circuit last time. Had put together a hat trick of wins before leaving the mainland so is capable. Shouldn't spend a penny from this draw. Has winning claims. MY ULTIMATE JACKO (6) is a newcomer to Tasmania having last raced when successful by 2 metres at Wagga five weeks ago. Can measure right up. SCARLET PLACE (10) draws on the back line but is in contention after scoring last start by 3.2 metres at this venue. FIESTA STRIDE (5) is in the mix having placed in both starts since winning here.

race_form.race_comment: SNOW PRINCE (8) comes through the 3YO Magic Millions where he was only 1.9L off the winner. He'll strip fitter from that effort, with the inside draw and booking of CJP both ticks. Respect the stables opinion to throw him in the deep end his past couple of starts. Can return to the winners' stall. SUPPORTIVE (9) has been superb her past four outings. May have been too far back last start but still ran a superb race. A repeat effort would see her go very close to winning. INDIE RULER (4) can't be knocked on his recent form, just missing out on the four-peat last start. Visors go back on as he rises to a trip he's been successful at previously. Probably looking for this trip now and it wouldn't surprise to see him get back to winning ways. VAMPI AT PLAY (10) may be back in form now after a long break and can go on with the job. EXCELTRAIN (6) will find this a little tougher but if he's not out of this if he can hold his form.

race_form.race_comment: HUIMANG CHAMP (3) was below his best last time when sixth over 1800m at this track, beaten 7 lengths. Has his share of talent. Mixing form but looks hard to beat on best in this suitable race. BARAMUI GEOM (7) returns from a spell of three-and-a-half months and did win first-up last time in work over 1400m at this track. One of the genuine hopes in the race. MY KHAN (2) had been in top form landing two consecutive wins but last start missed the frame when fourth over 1600m at this track. Should park just off the speed. One to consider. WONDERFUL PURGE (10) resumes. Didn't make an impact at his only run last prep on December 17 finishing fifth and beaten 5.5 lengths over 1400m at this track. Has switched to the Lim Chae Deok yard over the break. Looks one of the genuine hopes in the race.

Looks one of the genuine hopes in the race.

race_form.race_comment: OCEAN ZAR (9) is a lightly raced but progressive mare who improved off a fresh placing to win by more than three lengths here last time. Steps up to the mile and is race fit. Big chance again. THESECONDATPORTSEA (16) ran on to score by a neck when she resumed over 1350m at Doomben last start. Races well second up and the longer trip should suit. KINETIC (8) improved to place last start and is in the mix along with last-start winner SENESCHAL (4).

Races well second up and the longer trip should suit. KINETIC (8) improved to place last start and is in the mix along with last-start winner SENESCHAL (4).

race_form.race_comment: LIM'S SALTORO (4) puts an unbeaten record on the line after three straight wins, the latest over 1200m on turf 16 weeks ago. Returned a strong figure on debut, good enough for him to take this out. KING ZOUSTAR (2) ran fourth at his latest appearance over 1200m at this track, finishing 1.3 lengths from the winner. Has sound form here at this trip with seven wins and nine minor placings from 39 runs. Among the top chances. SACRED BUDDY (12) is close to a second career win after a string of minor placings, the latest when second over 1200m on turf when he was always up in the leading division. Big chance with the light weight. REIGNITE (1) was in the money two starts back at this track but was unable to repeat the effort last time when eighth, beaten 3 lengths, on turf over 1200m. Looks well placed so expect a better run this time.

Looks well placed so expect a better run this time.

f03fa813-4e98-4e8b-b62c-cb2f8be8bc33.race_name: Ladbrokes Sports Bar 1-4 Win Heat 3 1-4 Wins H

race_form.race_comment: FIRE LIGHTER (2) goes very well this trip starting six times for three wins and two minors. Recorded a 15 length win (29.74) in a Grade 5 last time at this track. Has the ability and looks a key chance here. HUSH HUSH (1) is generally an honest type in the frame at four of eight starts but missed the placings last time when sixth (30.38) over 520m at this track. Rates a winning chance on best. ASHBY JAZZY (3) jumped from a middle draw last time and could manage only 4th and beaten 3.5 lengths (30.54) at this track. Smart beginner who should take advantage of the low draw. Has ability and can atone. LIKE LUKE (4) comes into calculations after placing most recently.

f4e47aab-38ac-4a51-b060-caacda7e754d.race_name: Buy A Qtis Yearling 11-12 March Hcp

race_form.race_comment: SHARP DAZZLER (2) is really delivering now having scored at his last two starts at this track, most recently by 1.5 lengths over 1600m. Back in trip but ran on to score well over this journey two back. Big chance to land the hat trick. GRAND METEOR (11) is a progressive mare who improved off a second on debut at this track for a maiden win over 1110m at Doomben last time, leading and kicking away. Has more to offer so can go on with it. HYDE PARK (3) heads north off a last-start fourth at Warwick Farm and should be reaching peak fitness. Last-start winner THREE GONGS (6) has done little wrong so far and could take the next step.

Last-start winner THREE GONGS (6) has done little wrong so far and could take the next step.

race_form.race_comment: MOON RAIDER (1) had been in super honest form hitting the frame three times on end before finishing fourth (30.17) at this track last time. Good beginner assisted by the inside draw. Has ability and is a key runner. NAT NISMO (6) made a promising debut when settling back and giving a start but getting home hard into second (23.21) at this track over 400m. Expecting significant improvement this line-up. ELITE KODA (7) is on debut without trialling for this. Bold showing expected here. NEVER HOME (2) returns from a five weeks layoff and deserves plenty of thought.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: MOON RAIDER (1) had been in super honest form hitting the frame three times on end before finishing fourth (30.17) at this track last time. ELITE KODA (7) is on debut without trialling for this. Bold showing expected here. NEVER HOME (2) returns from a five weeks layoff and deserves plenty of thought.

race_form.race_comment: LUCK APLENTY (8) hasn't won for an age but continues to threaten and she was close-up here 7 days ago in a CL3. Just missed at Taree three back and this is her chance to bounce back. JUST ONE LOOK (1) has needed the two runs this preparation both at Newcastle. Much better suited in this and has the first-time blinkers applied. He will give away a start but has more to give and should be finishing hard. FINANCE PARTNER (4) showed some ability early doors but has been struggling to find his mojo. Went a bit better at Tamworth last time and shouldn't be too far away. SPANISH MISSILE (3) well-drawn and on the quick back-up. In the mix.

race_form.race_comment_alternative: LUCK APLENTY (8) hasn't won for an age but continues to threaten and she was close-up here 7 days ago in a CL3. Just missed at Taree three back and this is her chance to bounce back. JUST ONE LOOK (1) has needed the two runs this preparation both at Newcastle. Much better suited in this and has the first-time blinkers applied. He will give away a start but has more to give and should be finishing hard. FINANCE PARTNER (4) showed some ability early doors but has been struggling to find his mojo. Went a bit better at Tamworth last time and shouldn't be too far away. SPANISH MISSILE (3) well-drawn and on the quick back-up. In the mix.

race_form.race_comment: CAWBOURNE SPADE (2) slotted in just off the lead from the wide draw last start and boxed on to finish third (29.96) at Gosford in a Grade 5 over 515m. Key chance in this line up. CURYO DANCER (1) was a winner two back but last start drifted back and wound up strongly to finish a 4 length third at Maitland (25.76). Can measure up. GULLY GIRL (7) turned in a better effort at this track last start, finishing second behind Express Pearl (30.05) in a Grade 5. Has the early speed to land on the pace and can stick on. Didn't win last time but still ran one of the quickest times on the card. Leading player again. WEST END RIOT (5) warrants respect following a recent placing.

Didn't win last time but still ran one of the quickest times on the card. Leading player again. WEST END RIOT (5) warrants respect following a recent placing.

race_form.race_comment: MY DOG DIESEL (1) loves racing at this circuit with two wins and five placings from just eight attempts and will have come on with that first-up run now under the belt. Again gets the benefit of Champkin's 2kg claim and looks set to run another bold race. FIFTY CARATS (4) hails from a handy barn and has to be included. JUST LOOKING (6) has had one run back from a break and was well held in sixth over 1000m at Eagle Farm four weeks ago. Still early in the prep but goes well second-up and worth including. GRANDEUR ROSE (9) best of the rest.

GRANDEUR ROSE (9) best of the rest.

race_form.race_comment: AT THE ROXY (3) ran below best last time finishing fourth (26.37) over 431m at this track in a Maiden. Has good early burn and is drawn to be prominent. Tough to beat if on-song. BUBBLE BABY (2) was in the minors two back (25.72) at this track but ran below best last time there, finishing 7th. Cannot be underestimated. BYE BYE BILLY (5) filled a minor placing last start at this track behind Hara's Luna (31.18) in a Novice race. Chased the leaders and with a clean run can be prominent. Solid beginner who can clear the tricky draw. Leading player again. SO DAPPER (7) is a last-start placegetter who should be thereabouts.
